p: Events meeting our selection criteria occurred in 41 out of 47 WHO member states in the African Region. Uganda registered the highest number of events (n = 21); The Gambia, Rwanda, and Seychelles registered the fewest (n = 1). São Tomé and Príncipe, Guinea-Bissau, Gabon, Equatorial Guinea, Eritrea, and Eswatini did not report any disease outbreak with a start date during the study period ( Figure 2). Cholera (18.6%) was the most frequently reported outbreak disease, followed by measles (11.1%), dengue fever (7.8%), Crimean-Congo hemorrhagic fever (7.4%), poliomyelitis (5.7%), and meningococcal disease (5.4%) ( Table 2).
